elements.title: Brainbox AI
elements.description: Located in Montreal, Canada our team is comprised of experts in the fields of AI, data science, real estate, HVAC and energy efficiency. We are driven by the fact that 20% of global greenhouse gas emissions originate from buildings and that HVAC systems are responsible for over 50% of those emissions.

elements.title: Knight Frank report - E-mobility is the future. But what does that mean for real estate?
elements.description: The  Energy & Sustainability team explores how the growth of electric vehicles will impact real estate and what opportunities exist for landlords, developers and occupiers. The e-mobility report is [here](https://knightfrank.foleon.com/pitch/e-mobility/introduction/)

elements.title: Passive Logic
elements.description: Sensors and actuators with a software platform that automates the whole building life cycle. [Keyframe capital](https://www.keyframecapital.com/) has invested in them

elements.title: Buildings IOT
elements.description: We develop and deploy cloud-based building analytics software, we implement complex Integrated Building Management Systems, we design and install controls systems, we maintain building assets and we provide IT managed services.

elements.title: Metrikus
elements.description: Metrikus is a platform that helps to make buildings more efficient. Implemented at Met Office HQ, [in the news](https://www.twinfm.com/article/monitoring-energy-usage-at-met-office-hq)

elements.title: CarbonLaces
elements.description: Climate Finance Platform that defines a new category called ‘buildings as a hub of activity’ and recommends actions based on efficiency

elements.title: Dabbel
elements.description: Buildings, self-driven. The DABBEL AI reduces your building’s HVAC energy consumption and CO₂ emissions by up to 40%. Based in Dusseldorf

elements.title: Ecopilot
elements.description: Improve the working environment, improve productivity – Our clients/customers describe Ecopilot® and as an Artificial Intelligence that enables our various systems to collaborate, rather than constantly working against each other.

elements.title: Arbnco
elements.description: building performance software platform for utilities, national property managers and commercial real estate.

elements.title: Reach
elements.description: Technology accelerator with the backing of the National Association of REALTORS

elements.title: Bee Bryte
elements.description: software-as-a-service minimizing utility bills with automatic control of heating-cooling equipment (e.g. HVAC), pumps, EV charging points and/or batteries. Based in Lyon and Singapore.

elements.title: Grid edge
elements.description: Grid edge is an energy analytics platform for commercial buildings. They want to change the way that people use energy by putting data-driven, intelligent control into the hands of commercial energy consumers. Has [raised 2.5M in Oct 19](https://www.bp.com/en/global/corporate/news-and-insights/press-releases/bp-expands-its-digital-energy-portfolio-by-investing-in-energy-management-platform-grid-edge.html) from BP Ventures

elements.title: Nuuka
elements.description: Nuuka is a Finnish software company that develops and provides Smart Building Management Software to commercial real estate owners.

elements.title: EnergyPlus
elements.description: EnergyPlus is a whole building energy simulation program that engineers, architects, and researchers use to model both energy consumption—for heating, cooling, ventilation, lighting and plug and process loads—and water use in buildings. Funded by the U.S. Department of Energy’s (DOE) Building Technologies Office (BTO), and managed by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL)

elements.title: Demand Logic
elements.description: Demand Logic is an energy control and optimisation platform for commercial buildings, similar to Fabriq.

elements.title: EcoSync Energy
elements.description: EcoSync Energy  have created a cloud-based platform for existing building technologies like the room booking system and heating control to synchronise and communicate so as to provide heating for occupied areas only.

elements.title: 75f
elements.description: 75f  is a IoT smart HVAC solution makes commercial buildings more comfortable and energy efficient. Funded by [breakthrough energy ventures](https://www.gatesnotes.com/Energy/Buildings-are-good-for-people-and-bad-for-the-climate)

elements.title: Open Sensors
elements.description: OpenSensors provides a smart Building Management System with sensors and analytics tools analyse effective use of your space.

elements.title: GRESB
elements.description: GRESB mission is to enhance and protect shareholder value by assessing and empowering sustainability practices in the real asset sector. Providing environmental, social and governance (ESG) performance on assets. (mentioned in Fabriq newsletter)
